New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0.
The Cavaliers ended their NBA-record streak of scoring 110 points in 10 consecutive wins to open a season.
Key Match Events: Evan Mobley had 23 points and 16 rebounds.
Darius Garland scored eight of his 20 points in the fourth quarter.
Garland put the Cavaliers ahead for good at 97-96 with two free throws.
Cam Johnson scored 23 points for the Nets.
Dennis Schroder and Cam Thomas had 22 points each for the Nets.
Garland scored four points in a row and fed Mobley for a dunk to complete a game-changing 10-point run.
Pre-Game Insights: New coach Kenny Atkinson admitted there was a little extra at stake for him facing Brooklyn for the first time since being fired by the Nets in 2020.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are two victories from matching the longest streak in franchise history, having won 13 in a row three times, all with LeBron James on the roster.
